comments.commentBody: Someone should help them sue those companies who are extracting resources, leaving money so the the next company can come along and sell the weapons to clear more land so they can extract more. World criminal court, UN sanctions whatever it takes. Pressure from U.S. citizens - ineffective now. Obama tried to stop this kind of thing by regulating it by making them report their payments and activity, but of course as soon as Republicans got in power they stopped the regulations. Sick, greedy.

Jennifer: I agree; what can we do to help?
Please, NY Times, please advise.

This is actually a very easy question to answer. First, it depends on what kind of culture the seventeen year old lives in - a sexually restrictive, semi restrictive or permissive culture. The U.S. fits into the semi-restrictive category, so definitely give them birth control, because this is the most dangerous type of culture for young lovers. In this culture we TELL adolescents not to have sex, but then we leave them alone. As a result, compared to the other types of culture, we have more teen pregnancies and some seriously skyrocketing std issues.
Restrictive cultures, where men and women are just kept apart and everyone knows how horny and impulsive 17 year olds can be, so they really just keep them apart so they won't have sex, maybe not, but if they are asking, well then, they have found a way, so yeah, even though statistics say the odds are lower teens will have sex. In permissive cultures - Northern Europe, this article would just get a laugh because there, they teach teens what they need to know and give them what they need to protect themselves and teens are allowed to couple up. And they also have low teem pregnancy rates.
Oh, and by the way - when you are around someone who is allowing, accepting, warm, attentive, and appreciative? You are in the presence of someone who is mature.

You're absolutely right. The problem is the inconsistency created by a half-liberal-half-conservative society. The inconsistencies, sometimes amounting to hypocrisy, can't be resolved.

History has shown, however, that a society that is somewhat more conservative than we have now, works best. One needs only to go back in time a few decades to see a society that was more productive and happy. Yes, there are instances of unhappiness, but the overall happiness was greater.
Happiness was greater for white men and that's about it. Let's not kid ourselves.

I spent a week in South Sudan when the people voted for independence. It seems many readers do not understand the subtext here.
(North) Sudan is Islamic. South Sudan is Christian. Sudan controlled all the oil money and repressed the Christian South. The US supported independence because it meant weakening (North) Sudan as South Sudan would now get a share of the oil money.
I saw Salva Kiir speak. I watched as women and men voted with so much optimism. I am very very sad to see that such horrors have come from it.

Just a quick note to tip my hat to the work of Tyler Hicks. He is brave, courageous and has a most amazing eye. He is one of the greatest photo journalists of our times, if not the best . Bravo and merci for your amazing work...
thank you, paula. it's heartbreaking.
You left out Somalia as one of the regions neighbors. America has a drone war against al Shaab currently underway, and using the country as a "black sight" for interrogations of suspected terrorist.

It is pathetic that once again an African nation is plunged into a miserable situation and the world seems helpless at the plight of starving children. Time to mobilize humanitarian assistance to alleviate hunger and lack of medical care. Just this morning I shared my thoughts in the NY times about the uncontrolled population growth in the poorest of countries in the world promoted by religious leaders and it is like the Pope heard me and later said that families should have fewer kids to make the world more sustainable. This is a welcome new beginning from the leader of the largest religious group. I hope the other religious group will follow the Pope's lead so that we have fewer kids in poverty and misery in the future. But for now the world needs to unite to provide the masses in the war torn areas to be lifted out of their plight and to live in dignity and humane environment. http://insider.foxnews.com/2017/03/04/pope-francis-fewer-children-world-...
A heartbreaking story.  I can't fathom the pain and suffering of these other human beings.  And a callous world stands by.  Forgive us.
And what do you suggest the 'world' (whatever that is) should do?
Seems like all the world needs is love sweet love. Will there always be war? The Bible says yes. Only the return of Jesus Christ will end it.
Really?!

Why can't an All-knowing, All-loving, All-powerful god end it right now?
Answer: Because there ain't no such thing! Never was! Never will be!
Wrong.  China, India, Malaysia.  The US has imposed sanctions on South Sudan oil companies.
Carefully executed coups have a wonderful history of establishing the ideal democracy and ending generations of institutionalized power plays. Good call.

KB,
Get real, it's North Korea that invaded South Korea, not the other way around. It is hardly ridiculous to believe that North Korea wouldn't attack when they've done it already and have armed forces of over a million. Likewise, Iran is already supporting armed forces in other territories. Those are actual facts which are closer to fact than you've gotten.
Loretta Lynch may be talking, but it's not to Russian Ambassadors, and then lying about it under oath.

Amen, Fact Boy.

I was just the right age when we first got a TV, toward the end of Beany and Cecil's reign, and I loved them. (Along with KFO, of course, and Frameface.)

Like you, in my world there would be no abortions. But in my world, there would be family planning clinics in every town. Women would have good, free prenatal and health care. We would have fact-based sex education. We would support children in poverty with good educations and health care. We would see all people as an asset to society not a burden.

Re-read this quote "The Guttmacher Institute...without Title X funding for family planning clinics, there would be, in a year, an additional 900,000 unplanned pregnancies — and 325,000 more abortions".

Facts mater. In other words - if the "Pro-life" groups took my approach, they would be closer to achieving their goal of an abortion-free world.
It does, but Trump isn't going to appoint any cabinet members who are not non compos mentis too. Sane people will not apply to work for him.

The strangest thing about Donald Trump's choke-hold on the Presidency is how it has managed to force itself  on our consciousness intermittently, yet oh so unpleasantly, as we go about our business throughout the "normal" course of the day. I have lived in the U.S. under 8 Presidents before Trump was elected. Whether I supported or did not support them, the fact of their sitting in the White House running the country did not really affect my mood or preoccupation with my own daily concerns-family, ,children, job, money etc. Now, as soon as I wake up in the morning, a grey, queasy, unsettled feeling comes over me as I realize Donald Trump was not just a bad dream. He's still here. And he's not going anywhere for the next 4 years, unless....
Why don't you believe Jared Kushner when he says that Russian money is pouring into the Trump Organization?

My first thoughts when I read this article were about making ridiculous (tweet) accusations news in the first place; this President craves attention like an addict craves heroin and the print and TV news media continually provide it even when there is no evidence to back up the accusations.
This would be a MAJOR story when/if there was a FISA warrant issued for surveillance of the trump organization and the FBI decided to release that information. Until then, these tweets are just more rantings from a very insecure, spoiled individual who acts like a petulant child when everything does not go his way.
Another thought was how this causes distraction and disinformation in order to redirect the public's attention on to someone else; yet another thing this President appears to be good at---laying blame on anyone other than himself. I guess he doesn't know "the buck stops at his desk"!
We cant scramble to get to the bottom of every wild accusation Trump comes up with.  It is time to dismiss his claims as more lies from someone who is indifferent to the truth.
All the tangible evidence indicates we are stupid.

He threw the word "sacred" in there to make his extreme, right-wing, evangelical  "Christian" base think he shares their religious views.  But the serious problem is, he doesn't know what is sacred, what is profane, and what is really just mundane.

I can’t help but to think about what young parents are telling their young children about these current issues?  Will your young children grow up to respect our system of government?  Think hard about this one because the future of making “America Great Again” depends on the belief of its citizens in its institutions.
Is this another incident suggesting that the current President is a bit unhinged?
